Linux 6.16.1 Fixes Intel GPU Driver Performance Regression

high

The Linux kernel version 6.16.1 addresses a significant performance regression in the Intel i915 GPU driver, affecting various metrics including up to a 30% drop in GPU texture bandwidth testing.

  • Intel i915 GPU Driver
  • Performance Regression Fix
  • Up To 30% Improvement
  • Commit acd7ccb284b8
  • Linux Kernel Version 6.16.1
Backend/TargetFix PatchGPUIntel GPU DriverLinux KernelOthersPerformancePerformance RegressionRegressionReleasei915

https://www.phoronix.com/news/Linux-6.16.1-Fixes-Intel-i915

Ghostty GTK Application Rewrite

medium

Mitchell Hashimoto has rewritten the Ghostty GTK application to fully embrace the GObject type system, leading to improvements in memory management and easier creation of custom GTK widgets. This rewrite supports modern GTK UI technologies like Blueprint.

  • Project/Component: Ghostty GTK Application
  • Target Architecture: Not specified
  • Optimization/IR/Pass Name: Memory Management Improvements
  • Version/Release: Expected in the upcoming 1.2 release
  • Regression/Performance Impact: Positive, with easier introduction of GUI features
  • Related PR/Commit/Discussion Links: https://lwn.net/Articles/1033954/
BlueprintGObject type systemGTKGhostty

https://lwn.net/Articles/1033954/

Security Updates for Multiple Distributions

high

This report covers security updates across various Linux distributions including AlmaLinux, Debian, Fedora, Oracle Linux, and SUSE.

  • AlmaLinux kernel updates in versions 8, 9, and 10
  • Debian security advisories for packages like aide, postgresql-13, chromium, apache2, openjdk-17, pgpool2, and more
  • Fedora updates for F41 and F42 releases including libtiff, mupdf, pandoc, glib2, matrix-synapse, openjpeg, python3-docs, and python3.13
  • Oracle Linux security advisories for packages like git, kernel, gdk-pixbuf2, glibc, java-1.8.0-openjdk, and more
  • SUSE updates for SLE15, SLE-m5.2 oS15.3, osB15 including ImageMagick, Mesa, cairo, chromium, and others
linux distributionssecurityupdates

https://lwn.net/Articles/1033901/https://lwn.net/Articles/1033737/https://lwn.net/Articles/1033588/

Generic VFIO Platform Driver To Be Marked As Deprecated For Removal

medium

Red Hat engineer Alex Williamson, who is the upstream maintainer of VFIO support and related pieces of the Linux virtualization stack, has posted patches to begin deprecating some unmaintained code.

  • vfio-fsl-mc driver has been orphaned since April 2024
  • vfio-platform and vfio-amba drivers have an active maintainer but no ability to test these drivers anymore
  • Hardware for the drivers has become obsolete
DeprecationLinux KernelRed HatVFIO

https://www.phoronix.com/news/VFIO-Platform-Deprecated

Ubuntu 25.10 Enters Its Feature Freeze Period

medium

With the beginning of the feature freeze, the Ubuntu development focus shifts primarily to testing and fixing bugs ahead of the anticipated 9 October release date. New point releases of software that don't introduce new features can also continue to land.

  • Ubuntu 25.10 enters its feature freeze period
  • Linux 6.17 kernel
  • GNOME 49 desktop atop Wayland
  • RISC-V support baseline ups to RVA23 profile
  • TPM-backed full disk encryption support
  • sudo-rs and other Rust-based components
  • Chrony by default
  • Dracut used by default
ChronyDracutGNOMELinux kernelRISC-VTPM-backed encryptionUbuntuWaylandsudo-rs

VirtualBox 7.2 Released With Windows 11 ARM Support, Linux 6.16 Compatibility

medium

Notable with VirtualBox 7.2 is now supporting VirtualBox on Windows 11 on Arm both as the host platform and then also VirtualBox VM Guest Additions support for Windows 11 on Arm guests. VirtualBox 7.2 also brings improvements to its user interface, compatibility with the Linux 6.16 kernel, Windows Hyper-V integration enhancements, and a variety of other fixes and improvements.

  • VirtualBox 7.2
  • Windows 11 ARM support as host platform
  • VM Guest Additions for Windows 11 on Arm guests
  • User interface improvements
  • Linux 6.16 kernel compatibility
  • Windows Hyper-V integration enhancements
Hyper-V IntegrationLinux 6.16User Interface ImprovementsVirtualBoxWindows 11 ARM

medium

The AMD Ryzen Threadripper PRO 9995WX, featuring 96 cores, is evaluated on a TRX50 platform with quad channel DDR5-6400 memory. The article discusses the performance of this processor in comparison to other models within the Zen 5 family.

  • 96 cores
  • TRX50 platform with quad channel DDR5-6400 memory

KDE Gear 25.08 Released With Improvements For Many KDE Apps

medium

The release of KDE Gear 25.08 includes several improvements for various KDE applications, focusing on memory usage reduction and enhanced functionalities.

  • Akonadi engine memory usage reduced by up to 75%
  • Better integration with Microsoft InTune enterprise authentication service
  • Improvements in Dolphin file manager
  • KRFB now supports non-European alphabets for desktop sharing
  • Neochat program allows creating polls
  • KDE Itinerary travel app lets users manually enter their train or bus trips

AMDXDNA Improvements & New Rockchip NPU Accelerator Driver For Linux 6.18

medium

Today's first drm-misc-next pull for the Linux 6.18 cycle includes now defaulting to using the NVIDIA GSP firmware by the Nouveau driver, affecting Turing and Ampere GPUs. Additionally, the Rocket driver, an open-source reverse-engineered Rockchip NPU driver, is being merged.

  • Nouveau driver defaults to NVIDIA GSP firmware
  • Affects Turing and Ampere GPUs
  • Rocket driver for Rockchip NPU accelerator upstreamed
  • User-space support ready with Mesa 25.3 atop Teflon framework
Ampere GPUsGSP firmwareLinuxMesaNVIDIARockchip NPURocket driverTeflon frameworkTuring GPUsdrm-misc-next

https://www.phoronix.com/news/DRM-Misc-Next-Linux-6.18

LibreOffice 26.2 To Better Handle Documents With Restricted Embedded Fonts

medium

A bug report from 2021 highlighted that LibreOffice did not provide users with information when embedded fonts could not be used due to licensing restrictions, leading to the impression that LibreOffice was malfunctioning.

  • LibreOffice 26.2
  • EmbeddedFontsHelper::sufficientTTFRights
  • restricted licensing rights
  • implementation of infobar

Linux 6.18 With Nouveau Driver Will Default To Using GSP Firmware

medium

The Nouveau driver beginning on the Linux 6.18 kernel will begin using the GPU System Processor (GSP) firmware by default but still have a fallback in place in case that firmware isn't supported.

  • Nouveau Driver
  • Linux Kernel 6.18
  • GPU System Processor (GSP) Firmware
  • Default Use of GSP Firmware
  • Fallback to Old Firmware if Necessary
GSP FirmwareKernel UpdateLinuxNouveau Driver

low

SR-IOV Support Limited to Intel Arc Pro Graphics Cards

medium

Intel has confirmed that SR-IOV support will only be available on their professional product SKUs, such as the Arc Pro graphics cards. This decision affects users who were hoping for SR-IOV support in consumer Battlemage graphics cards like the Arc B580 and Arc B570.

  • SR-IOV will only be supported on Intel Arc Pro Graphics Cards
  • Support is limited to professional product SKUs
  • Consumer Battlemage graphics cards do not have SR-IOV support
Battlemage GPUsIntel Arc Pro Graphics CardsLinux Kernel DriverProject BattlematrixSR-IOV

https://www.phoronix.com/news/Intel-SR-IOV-Only-For-Arc-Pro

Linux Preps For New "SoC Power Slider" With Upcoming Panther Lake

medium

The SoC Power Slider is a new system-wide energy performance preferences interface introduced with Panther Lake hardware, piggy-backing off the Linux platform profile API.

  • Panther Lake hardware
  • SoC Power Slider feature
  • Linux kernel mailing list patches
  • System wide energy performance preference using SoC slider interface
  • Three power profiles: 'performance', 'balanced', and 'low-power'
Energy Performance Preferences InterfaceLinuxPanther LakePlatform Profile APISoC Power Slider

https://www.phoronix.com/news/Intel-Panther-Lake-Power-Slider

NGINX Adds Native Support for ACME Protocol

low

NGINX has announced the preview release of the nginx-acme module, which adds native support to NGINX for the Automatic Certificate Management Environment (ACME) protocol. This addition simplifies and enhances SSL/TLS certificate management by reducing manual errors and eliminating much of the ongoing overhead traditionally associated with managing these certificates.

  • Project/Component: nginx-acme module
  • Target Architecture: NGINX
  • Optimization/IR/Pass Name: N/A
  • Version/Release: Preview release
  • Regression/Performance Impact: Reduces manual errors and overhead, creates a more secure workflow with fewer vulnerabilities.
  • Related PR/Commit/Discussion Links: https://lwn.net/Articles/1033657/
NGINXACME ProtocolSSL/TLS Certificate Management

https://lwn.net/Articles/1033657/

Google Develops KFuzzTest For Fuzzing Internal Linux Kernel Functions

low

Intel ISPC 1.28 Adds Optimized Support For AMD Zen 4 & Zen 5 CPUs

medium

ISPC 1.28 brings some minor language changes, now supports ISPC usage as a C++ library for embedding ISPC compilation directly into applications, Python integration enhancements, new standard library functions and more vector types, and various optimizations and fixes.

  • Intel ISPC 1.28
  • Optimized support for AMD Zen 4 & Zen 5 CPUs
  • ISPC-as-a-Library with experimental JIT compilation
  • Performance improvements on AVX-512 targets up to a 90% speed-up
  • Addition of AMD Zen 4 and Zen 5 target support
AMD Zen 4AMD Zen 5AVX-512ISPCJIT compilationperformance optimization

https://www.phoronix.com/news/Intel-ISPC-1.28

Rust 1.89.0 发布

medium

Rust 团队宣布了 Rust 的新版本 1.89.0。此版本通过 rustup 可以轻松更新。

  • 支持在 const 泛型参数中使用 _ 来从周围上下文中推断值
  • 不可以在签名中使用 _ 作为 const 泛型的参数
Rustconst genericsrustup

https://blog.rust-lang.org/2025/08/07/Rust-1.89.0/

Rust Project Goals Update - Async Programming Improvements

medium

The Rust project is working towards a slate of 40 goals with three flagship goals focused on improving support for async programming in Rust.

  • Improved support for async-fn-in-traits, subsuming the functionality of the async-trait crate
  • Progress towards sync and async generators to simplify iterator and async data stream creation
  • Improvement of Pin ergonomics for more approachable lower-level async coding
Rustasync programmingimprovementsproject goals

https://blog.rust-lang.org/2025/08/05/july-project-goals-update/https://blog.rust-lang.org/2025/06/20/may-project-goals-update/https://blog.rust-lang.org/2025/05/26/april-project-goals-update/

medium

  • 回归/性能影响：无明显提及
